page.title: 20Energy and South Kyme
page.content: Electricity is the main source of lighting and power. There is no North Sea Gas available, although the pipeline runs close by. Electricity, Calor Gas, oil, solid fuel, wood and straw are the fuels used for heating. These are delivered by lorry, to the house, but most farmers have their own supply of wood and straw. Power cuts are quite common in the winter months. Some farms and businesses have generators in case of power cuts, to keep machinery going. A few homes have double glazing, and most are insulated to save energy, as householders are becoming very aware of the increasing cost of fuel. {SOUTH KYME WOMEN'S INSTITUTE: Members {participating in the project: } E.Coney, J.Morris, D.Needs, J.Needs, S.Potter, E.Reddish, M.Tarrant, A.Wise.{
